availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, newspaper reporter and German-language interpreter. German native. Immigrated to Louisville. Served in the 1st Kentucky Cavalry Regiment during the Mexican-American War. Returned to Germany to fight in the revolutions of 1848 and 1849. Returned to Louisville. German-language interpreter for the Louisville City Court. Reporter for the Louisville Anzeiger. Lieutenant Colonel of the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment from December 13, 1861 to May 8, 1863.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, "LTC Jacob Ruckstuhl (1826-1866)," Memorial #67301482, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=67301482&ref=acom (accessed April 13, 2017). "In Memoriam," Louisville Daily Journal, September 3, 1866. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, Vol. 1 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 81.
